intro: Curtia tenuifolia var. tenerrima, commonly known as the slender leaf curtia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, spherical berries. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
